definition[0]: failure to pay money that you owe at the right time
example[0]: the risk of default by borrowers
example[1]: The company is in default on its loan agreement.
example[2]: The bank can seize the asset in the event of a default in payment.
definition[1]: failure to do something that you are supposed to do according to the law or because it is your duty
definition[2]: the way in which things are arranged on a computer screen unless you decide to change them
example[3]: You can change the default settings to suit your needs.
definition[3]: the usual and expected way in which something is done, unless you decide to do something different
example[4]: This way of working seems to be the default these days.
definition[4]: to fail to pay money that you owe at the right time
example[5]: He defaulted on his child support payments.
definition[5]: to not do something that you are supposed to do, especially that you are legally supposed to do
definition[6]: if something happens or is decided by default, it happens or is decided in that way because you did not do anything to change it
example[6]: They won the last election by default.
definition[7]: when someone fails to pay money that they owe at the right time
example[7]: An asset can be repossessed by a lessor in the event of a default on the lease payments.
example[8]: The banks have decided that the company is in default on its loan agreements.
definition[8]: when someone fails to do something that it is their duty to do
example[9]: The contract includes provisions for loss and expense suffered by the contractors due to default by the employer.
definition[9]: when someone fails to come to court or make a written statement when they are supposed to
example[10]: The defendant will have to explain his default and satisfy the court that he has a defence which ought to be heard.
definition[10]: the way in which things will be arranged on a computer screen or done by a computer unless you change them
example[11]: If the defaults are acceptable the user can just press Return.
example[13]: The default margin settings are 1.25 each for a page 8.5 wide.
example[14]: The Act covered what mortgage lenders could do to recover their money if borrowers defaulted.
definition[11]: to not do something that it is your duty to do
example[15]: If a party defaults in its obligations to the project, then the partyâ€™s right to continue participating in the project shall be terminated.
definition[12]: if a computer program defaults to a particular thing, it does that thing unless you instruct it to do something else
example[16]: Microsoft Word will default to starting each new line with a capital letter unless you customize the settings.
